   (7, 4), (11, 11), (14, -)

   Since we have an odd number of characters, we'll add an extra character, 'X' (23):
   (7, 4), (11, 11), (14, 23)

3. Multiply each pair of numbers by the matrix key:
   [0 1] [7]   [ 4]   [ 4]
   [2 3] [4] = [14] = [14]

   [0 1] [14]   [23]   [23]

4. Convert the resulting numbers back to letters:
   4 = E, 14 = O, 11 = L, 3 = D, 23 = X, 7 = H
